solution_line_template: Kyle and his mom eat a total of {kyle_eats_cookies} + {mom_eats_cookies} = <<{kyle_eats_cookies}+{mom_eats_cookies}={total_cookies_eaten}>>{total_cookies_eaten} cookies
Kyle and his mom eat a total of {kyle_eats_brownies} + {mom_eats_brownies} = <<{kyle_eats_brownies}+{mom_eats_brownies}={total_brownies_eaten}>>{total_brownies_eaten} brownies
The number of cookies remaining is {initial_cookies} - {total_cookies_eaten} = <<{initial_cookies}-{total_cookies_eaten}={remaining_cookies}>>{remaining_cookies} cookies
The number of brownies remaining is {initial_brownies} - {total_brownies_eaten} = <<{initial_brownies}-{total_brownies_eaten}={remaining_brownies}>>{remaining_brownies} brownies
From selling his cookies, Kyle makes {remaining_cookies} * ${cookie_price} = $<<{remaining_cookies}*{cookie_price}={money_from_cookies}>>{money_from_cookies}
From selling his brownies, Kyle makes {remaining_brownies} * ${brownie_price} = $<<{remaining_brownies}*{brownie_price}={money_from_brownies}>>{money_from_brownies}
Kyle would make a total of ${money_from_cookies} + ${money_from_brownies} = $<<{money_from_cookies}+{money_from_brownies}={total_money}>>{total_money} if he sold all of his baked goods
